title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 135.5 - Procedure to be followed by motorist who receives notice of revocation or suspension
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 135.5 - Procedure to be followed by motorist who receives notice of revocation or suspension

State Regulations
(a) If it is determined that a motorist is
not eligible for a restricted license, the motorist is required to surrender
his driver's license, if such license has not already been surrendered. An
application for a restricted license shall not be issued by the Department of

Motor Vehicles. (b) If a motorist
has had his or her driver's license suspended or revoked pursuant to section
510
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law and the department has determined that such
motorist is eligible for a restricted license, the motorist may, upon receipt
of a revocation or suspension order issued by the commissioner, make
application for such a license to a motor vehicle issuing office. To make such
an application, the motorist must submit the application for such license, all
required fees, a completed waiver form and any other necessary forms and proof
of compliance with the appropriate suspension or revocation order as directed
on the notice of revocation or suspension. The commissioner or designated
person shall make a determination as to the motorist's need to have a
restricted license and shall apply the criteria set forth in section
135.7
of this Part to determine
the final eligibility for a restricted license. If eligible and found to be in
need of a restricted license, a restricted license will be issued in accordance
with this Part. (c) If a motorist
has had his or her driver's license revoked pursuant to section
318
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law, the motorist may, upon receipt of a revocation
order issued by the commissioner, make application for a restricted license to
a motor vehicle issuing office. To make such an application, the motorist must
submit an application for such license, all required fees, a completed waiver
form and any other necessary forms and proof of compliance with the appropriate
revocation order or orders as directed on the notice or notices of revocation. The commissioner or designated person shall make a determination as to the
motorist's need to have a restricted license and will make a review of the
person's driving record to determine whether such person meets the provisions
of section
135.2
of this Part and the
criteria set forth in section
135.7
of this Part for eligibility
for the issuance of a restricted license. If eligible and found to be in need
of a restricted license, a restricted license will be issued in accordance with
this Part. (d) If a motorist has
had his driver's license suspended pursuant to section
510
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law for a conviction of section 1192(4) of such law, and the department has determined that he is eligible for a restricted license, such motorist must participate in and satisfactorily complete a rehabilitation
program as set forth in section
134.10
of this Title. Notes
